subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: how to transcribe air and ear
msgSnippet: All I m saying is that there is no precise sound of any vowel phoneme in English. If you wish to map a particular IPA sound to a QS letter you may do so, but
messageBody:
All I'm saying is that there is no precise sound of
any vowel phoneme in English. If you wish to map a
particular IPA sound to a QS letter you may do so, but
you will find situations where any particular mapping
will be disagreed with. Any such mapping will be at
least partly arbitrary.
Feel free to ignore this reply if I'm still missing
the point, I'm following this conversation with
interest.

--- Paul Tremblay <phthenry@...> wrote:
> What we need is a precise way to describe the sound
> of each letter.


===========
Never insult anyone by accident.
- Robert A. Heinlein
